summary: This is the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust Agreement, dated January 18, 2019, which revokes a prior 2018 trust. It establishes Epstein as the Grantor with Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as Trustees, detailing extensive posthumous bequests to numerous individuals, forgiveness of debts, and the creation of specific trusts for properties and beneficiaries, including Karyna Shuliak and another primary beneficiary whose name is redacted.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The creator of the trust, who assigns property to the trustees and outlines extensive bequests and conditions for distribution after his death.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Named as a Trustee of the 2019 Trust, responsible for administering the trust estate. Also a significant beneficiary receiving a $20 million bequest and having debts forgiven.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Named as a Trustee of the 2019 Trust, responsible for administering the trust estate. Also a significant beneficiary receiving a $20 million bequest and having debts forgiven.

persons.name: Karyna Shuliak
persons.context: A major beneficiary designated to receive $100 million outright, a $20 million annuity, and multiple properties (Paris, Florida) in trust, with provisions for her use and occupancy.

connections.description: Epstein appoints Indyke as a Trustee of his 2019 Trust and makes him a major beneficiary ($20M). The document also references Indyke's employment/service to Epstein or his entities.
Epstein appoints Kahn as a Trustee of his 2019 Trust and makes him a major beneficiary ($20M). The document also references Kahn's employment/service to Epstein or his entities.
Epstein designates Shuliak as a primary beneficiary of $100 million outright, a $20 million annuity, and multiple properties in trust, indicating a very significant financial relationship.
Referenced as spouses in the context of debt repayment provisions and Saipher's $3 million bequest tied to a real estate contract involving Indyke.
Referenced as spouses in the context of debt repayment provisions from entities beneficially owned by them.
Fontanilla receives a substantial bequest and property transfer, and has loans forgiven, indicating a close financial and likely employment relationship.
Groff receives a bequest, has loans forgiven, and is among staff whose debts will be repaid, indicating an employment relationship.
Serve as co-Trustees of the 2019 Trust, required to act unanimously on decisions, indicating a close professional partnership.
Barrett's financial obligations to Epstein are to be repaid from the trust, indicating a debtor-creditor or business relationship.

events.title: Execution of Epstein 2019 Trust
events.description: Jeffrey E. Epstein executes the 'Jeffrey E. Epstein 2019 Trust' agreement, revoking a prior 2018 trust, with Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as Trustees.

events.title: Revocation of 2018 Trust
events.description: The agreement expressly revokes 'The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2018 Trust' previously created by Epstein, rendering it void as of the execution date.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein created a new trust in January 2019, just months before his death, revoking a prior 2018 trust.
The trust designates Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as Trustees and major beneficiaries, each receiving $20 million bequests and having their debts to Epstein forgiven/repaid.
Karyna Shuliak is the largest named beneficiary, slated to receive $100 million outright, a $20 million annuity, and multiple high-value properties (in Paris, Florida) in trust.

The document contains numerous redactions for beneficiary names, particularly for individuals designated to receive annuities and properties, including a primary beneficiary referenced as the alternate recipient to Karyna Shuliak and the residuary beneficiary.

The trust includes provisions to forgive loans made to over two dozen named individuals and entities, and to repay debts owed to Epstein by staff and associates, effectively insulating them from financial obligations after his death.
